channel.title: [SOLVED] [PI] [317] Minor Yell Problem
channel.description: Fixed thanks to The Wanderer. Thank you.

item.title: [SOLVED] [PI] [317] Minor Yell Problem
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Here’s an explanation for .substring()

You can always create a new String by appending two existing strings together with the + operator, or by taking their substring:

String fullName = "Robert Smith"; String firstName = fullName.substring(0, 6); String message = "Hello, " + firstName; System.out.println(message);

This would result in:

Hello, Robert

In Java, Strings are zero-based, meaning that the first character is always at position 0. (In Computer Science we always start consider zero to be the “first” number… this may take some getting used to, but it is very standard).

The substring method takes two integer arguments, and returns a new String that is created starting at the offset indicated by the first argument, and ending just before the second argument.

So in your example it is ignoring the first 5 characters in your command. which would be "yell ".

.toLowerCase() is simply a method that changes every character in the aforementioned string to lowercase letters.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] [PI] [317] Minor Yell Problem

item.title: [SOLVED] [PI] [317] Minor Yell Problem
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { String rank = ""; String Message = playerCommand.substring(4).toLowerCase(); if (c.playerRights == 1) { rank = "@cya@[Mod]@bla@"+ c.playerName +":@dre@ "; } if (c.playerRights == 2) { rank = "@whi@[Admin]@bla@"+ c.playerName +":@dre@ "; } if (c.isDonator == true && c.playerRights == 0) { rank = "@or2@[Donator]@bla@"+ c.playerName +":@dre@ "; } if (c.playerRights == 0 && !c.isDonator) { rank = "[@bla@Player@bla@]"+ c.playerName +":@dre@ "; } if (c.playerRights == 3) { rank = "@red@[Owner & Developer]@dre@"+ c.playerName +": "; } if(Connection.isMuted(c)) { c.sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell"); return; } for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage(rank+Message); } }

Read full topic
